page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content:
POPULATION
The total population of Stanhoe is 220 to which must be added 14 people at Shammar. Of Stanhoe's occupants 54 are of pensionable age, a high proportion. The majority of these have lived in the village for most of their working lives but there are also a few who came here on leaving work in urban areas. The young make up a much smaller proportion of the total, 24 being under 16 years. Except for the new houses which have so far brought 4 retired couples into the community the population remains fairly steady, there being relatively little movement of married couples and their families as there is in areas where a better job usually means a move. Once established most prefer to stay where they are and several have settled here
